Reviews.Title: “Not the best position but pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Grockledevon
Reviews.Content: Nice room in a modern hotel. Plenty of bars and restaurants on the marina near by. Do not drink in the hotel. 25€ for two gin and tonics instead of 11€ on the marina.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: travelling006
Reviews.Content: great hotel located near the seaside and Barceloneta. Great staff at reception which are very helpful! rooms were perfect and cosy. breakfast at pullman is always a feast! only downside is that we were the month of march and it was 20 degres, but the rooftop pool was not open. (we could access it, but poolbar was not open) eventhough there were many people enjoying the sun at the rooftop. would definately come back here. fantastic views from the rooftop. we wanted to enjoy the sauna but this was only for people who enrolled for a massage or other package at the spa. we could only access it if we would pay extra - should be free for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AggieTravels357
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. I was in France for three weeks and came to Barcelona for a weekend. The rooms were enormous compared to the other hotel rooms I stayed at in France. Instantly I felt like I can actually breathe and move around lol the rooms were clean, Huge beds, plenty of closet space, mutli language channels, and the bathroom was huge. The breakfast was included in the price and was well suited for my needs. The paella was fantastic but I had to to convence like 3 employees to give it to me since I was only one (was really recommended for two, but I'm american and can handle it lol). The hotel is really close to the beach and the train station which was spectacular. The roof top pool and jacuzzis were awesome as well. I didnt actually get to go to the roof top bar when it was open, I dont know why tho. If I'm ever back in Barcelona I would definately look into staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: charlesp
Reviews.Content: Nothing to fault. Great rooms, nice views, awesome wifi, top notch breakfast buffet, indoor and outdoor seating options, perfect for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, good location and with nice staff”
Reviews.Author: MiguelVanderWoodsen
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel with nice staff. The location is good but not completly central. There are not many shops around however the subway is not far and the beach is right in front of the hotel. There are many restaurants in front of the hotel. The jacuzzi is on the top floor and it has a excellent view. The room is very good and the bed is excellent with comfortable pillows

Reviews.Title: “A real 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mariner55
Reviews.Content: Often 5 stars are not equal to great services !! This is not the case for this Hotel. It is located close to the beach and to the Olimpic Port. It is very close to the City Center too. The rooms are clean and adequate in terms of space. The bathroom is nice with Bath and Shower. The bed are excellent and silence is sure. Nice view on the city. The only negative point I could find is the cost of their Parking in the basement : 25€/day. Considering that the taxi in Barcelona are very convinient (from hotel to the city center is aroung 5€) I would not rent a car the next time. Really excellent are the breakfast, with am incredible buffet specially from a quality point of view, and the all services. I really recommend this hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel and Wonderful Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: SushantRathi
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels in Barcelona. Located beach side with many discotheques in the vicinity. Loved the rooms. Spacious and Comfortable. Hotel even offered us a Champagne as a gift which was really awesome! A bit too expensive though! Will surely visit the Pullman again. Thanks Accor!

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: jkruger
Reviews.Content: stayed here while attending a conf. at the nearby hotel Arts. Nice rooms, nice full english breakfast. Would for sure return to this place

Reviews.Title: “A stylish modern hotel close by the sea”
Reviews.Author: vladmuc
Reviews.Content: Pullman Skipper is a stylish modern hotel in a modern part of Barcelona, close by the sea. I liked the design of the room. Very modern but not cold as there is a lot of wood in the room. The staff is very friendly and competent. The next metro station is only 5 minutes away (Ciutadella / Vila Olimpica).

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Plato99
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel next to the beach with impeccable customer service. The rooms are nice, the pool is great, but the hotel's greatest asset is the staff, who really go out of their way to treat all of their guests like they are special. Even though we are definitely not one of their high-revenue customers, everyone in the hotel treated us like we were royalty. I highly recommend the Pullman Skipper.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice, can't go wrong!”
Reviews.Author: Gaurangd12
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights during Spring break with a young child. It's a great modern hotel based near the beach, port Olympic and city centre. Metro station is close by and Barcelona hop on-hop off tourist bus route goes right outside hotel. Hotel is perfect with all modern amenities and very good room sizes. Breakfast spread is as good as any 5* hotel should be with loads of choices for everyone. Rooftop bar is a nice place to have a drink in the evening. Library has decent amount of books to educate a first timer about the city and Gaudi's works.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Henrik T
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just spent 3 days in Barcelona at Pullman Barcelona Skipper. The hotel - comfort and food, location as well as the service from all staff was perfect! Our highest recommendations for this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Right choise”
Reviews.Author: aycanyurt
Reviews.Content: Not only for business meetings but also for private purposes, I pretty much recommend this hotel. Comfortable room, enjoyed the variety of foods during meals / coffee breaks. Very friendly hotel staff.. Most important, close to beach and walking distance to shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: cfcmoss
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the skipper between the 8th an 11th March 2012, as a treat for my wife's birthday. From the moment the hotel was booked to the moment we left, the service was nothing short of outstanding. The check in was extremely fast and efficient. We stayed in room 610 (superior room, balcony and sea view). The room was absolutely immaculate and cleaned every day. The bathroom was of the same standard with a great shower and large bath, with plenty of toiletries, robes, slippers and towels. The breakfast(included) was varied (cold meats,plenty of fruit, cereals and hot food), and of a very good quality. The hotel was located about 100 meters from the beach, and about a 15 minute walk from La Rambla, which was ideal for us. Will definitely stay there agin next time I visit Barcelona, and would totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Hana T
Reviews.Content: The location, service and room are all fabulous. The breakfast buffet is the best we have ever experienced in any hotel. Most of all the staff are extremely friendly and efficient. We highly reccomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leanne S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in port olympica, where in my opinion is the nicest part of Barcelona, the hotel has fantastic views of the cost line and is walking distance to La Rambla (Aprox 15 min) its a lovely walk past the ports and sea front. We didnt use the metro system at all there was no need with everything being such a short walk. We took a open top bus tour around the city €24 tickets available at the hotel, and pick up point just outside hotel, how ever i advise that you walk to La Rambla and get bus from there. (Basically theres a red line and a green line and the red line started in the city centre and had more points of intrest for us). Lovely resturants down by the port olympia. Also an all night casino ! Do not get excited if you have been to vegas its a major let down, but was a bit of fun, language barrier can be a problem! The hotel location was so central, the staff done everything possible to make our stay an enjoyable one, they all were so professional and have fantastic english. We stayed in a Junior Suite, room was fab, with an amazing bathroom with fab jacuzzi, and decoreted lovely however it appeared that they had forgot to either paint or walpaper one wall which was disapointing, i went to reception and they came straight up to the room to look, however it apperently is Japeanease feature !! Looked just unfinished, but staff were lovely about it! We went off for a walk and on return they had a bottle of chanpangue in the room and choclates, which was a lovely surprise! The room was complete as a five star should be with everything you would need for a short stay (tooth brush, tooth paste, shampoos, conditioners, body wash, body lotion, razors, shaving gels, and perfume). Breakfast was buffy style including, cereals, jucies, crossiants, various breads, platters of fruit and yogurts, hot buffy seletion also available ( far from an irish breaki ! but some may like it !! ). Breakfast was worth is however it set you up for the day. Hotel so accomadating we were allowed to check in early and had a lateflight home on the monday and got a late check out until 3pm. I would have thought all 5 star hotels would have a i-doc system for iphones/ipods in room, however not this one!! Reception were acomadaing and left an iphone charger in room when asked. Overall my boyfriend and I had a lovely long weekend and would well recommend this hotel for anyone on a short break to see the city !

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room with a window that watches the bus drive by... save your money for a beach view”
Reviews.Author: SusiBarton
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for business. It is a 2 minute walk from the beach and costs as much as Hotel Arts next door which offers sea view rooms. I was given a room on the first floor that gave me significant street noise from outside and I could hear all the bar and restaurant noise from my door. I requested another room and the next day they gave me a room on a higher floor that was much quieter. That said, the rooms are ok but not impressive given the significant price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent, beautiful and the best hotel breakfast EVER”
Reviews.Author: Trvsdg
Reviews.Content: Verygood, nice location, the staff was so helpfull and they really wanted to give good service from their heart. And the oly" bad" thing who I think was a one time situasion The room service.. But this was not a big thing.. Because all the other things was so good that we forget it. I give this hotell from 1 to 10 a 10! They worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A functional Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Voyager26
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Pullman Hotel. Billed as a five star hotel. My view is its more like a 4* hotel, well situated in Barcelona, not too far from the 5 star establishment , the Arts Hotel. It's a functional business Hotel with all the room amenities, ( fast wi-fi in room, multi channel TV, Bath and shower, modern ( art deco) , nice roomy lobby etc. on most nights the restaurant was not open for dinner though the chef was flexible to prepare dinner for a small party per- arranged. We were not disappointed with the food. Tasty and well presented with generous portions Rooms are mid size and comfortable, but pricey ( it was GSM congress week, I guess).

Reviews.Title: “perfect, except missing wireless connection”
Reviews.Author: Sarah T
Reviews.Content: amazing hotel and beautiful rooms, large and clean. however was missing internet connection in my room because it was the last room at the end of the corridor. but they gave a cable to hook up my laptop to the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel close to the beach”
Reviews.Author: JARMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights as a base for touring Barcelona. As Accor members we decided to stay here. An excellent hotel, however as tourists it was slightly out of town. Next time we might stay in the gothic district. However it's close to the metro line and you are in the gothic area within 10-15 minutes. Plenty of good restaurants and shops down towards the beach. We had excellent meals there. Would stay again but only if doing a conference nearby.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Boyfromla
Reviews.Content: In the new area of Barcelona , a great hotel . Nice welcome - Room not ready , a coffee is offered to keep you waiting . Rooms are very spacious , with nice view over the city . On the roof , outside swimming pool with a bar . Good buffet in the morning for breakfast with various juices - pastries - ham - cheese Very easy to get to the city centre . We will return to this hotel on our next trip .

Reviews.Title: “Good location great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Tom35
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel in January 2012. Staff was very helpful, booked superior room. The hotel is not far from the beach but only top floor can enjoy the see view. Room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The hotel is not far from the subway station Ciutadela, some 15 min from Rambla on feet. If you managed to get the rate below EUR 150 p.n. it is worth the money. Otherwise, look for better options - Barcelona is full of opportunities.

Reviews.Title: “One of my best trips”
Reviews.Author: Cathrine P
Reviews.Content: In the summer 2009, we spent 6 days in this great hotel. It lies almost at the beach, and has many of the attractions in walking distance. At the roof, there is a pool - a very populare one - with a great view. There's not as many sunbeds as guest, witch makes kind of an unpolite culture. Many guest are quite selfish, so often there are towels on all the beds while "the owners of the towels" are either sleeping or eating breakfast. Luckly there is one other pool, at the ground floor, and you also have 1 minute walk to the beach. The hotel is beautiful and the staff is very friendly. The rooms are great with good space and we got a nice view. The food tasted very good but is totally overpriced. Especially the breakfast - ridicolously expencive. I think it was about 250 norwegian kroner pr.p. With that said, I have to brag about the town. I really love Barcelona. It's one of my favourite places. It has EVERYTHING. I would recomend the sighseeing buses, witch you can hop on and off as you please. Sagrada Familia and La Pedrera (Gaudi's work) are among the most populare attractions in Barcelona. But be prepared for long queue. Casa Batllo and Casa Amatller both looks like they're made of sugar and is worth a look. Also the view from Museum National D'Art is stunning. Font Magica is worth a visit when the show is on - fantastic. We paid both the aqarium and the zoo a visit. In the zoo you get sea-lion- show and dolphin- show, witch I think is quite cute :) We also took a trip with a Katamaran (sailboat) and enjoyed the sight of Barcelona from a sea- perspective. I could go on even further with tips and suggestions, but - take a trip to Barcelona and experience everything yourself :)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the jacuzzi on the roof top!”
Reviews.Author: Gartenbach
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel close to the party-beach-area: 1 minute walking! We got a room with sea view at 5th floor left wing which is great since the sun stays very long on the balcony. Distance to old town (picasso museum) is about 15 minutes onwards. Staff is superior: very friendly and very helpful! Fitness: fitness centre in the hotel is tiny but there is a fitness park about 2 minutes walking distance for 16eur/day which provide a good facility. Fun: we were using the jacuzzi on the roof top few times. Very cool sitting there, enjoy a glass of wine and overlooking Barcelona... I will be here again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel... Great Location”
Reviews.Author: elainec22
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend just returned from Barcelona where we spent 3 nights at the Hotel Pullman Barcelona. We were allowed to check in early on arrival as we had an early flight and given a late check out. It was my boyfriends birthday and we were sent up a complimentary bottle of cava and chocolates to the room. The room was spacious and beautifully decorated and we had a lovely view of the swimming pool. Breakfast was amazing, lots of choice and served until 11.30 on weekends. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Ask Elena”
Reviews.Author: EMERENCE
Reviews.Content: The location of this well designed hotel is excellent since it is convenient to many places. We walked to and from the Ramblas with no problem. The beach is just about a block away and has wonderful sunsets from all of the restaurants lining the strip. Since we do not speak Spanish, it was wonderful to be able to seek help from the Front Office Supervisor, Elena. She solved all of our problems and made good suggestions. She is an asset to to the accorhotels chain.

Reviews.Title: “1 block from the beach”
Reviews.Author: craig0581
Reviews.Content: Nice location right near the beach and bus stop for the tour bus.about a 5 minute walk for either. Cleanliness: Very well maintained. Rooms: Also extremely sterile, bedrooms are nice, balconies can allow noise in your room if they overlook the courtyard while a convention is going on. The bathrooms are spacious, with a tub and a shower, sink area with a nice large vanity with all up to date modern appliances. Once again extremely clean! Staff: Very polite, always at the front desk. Helpful with directions, recommendations of restaurants, how to utilize the tour buses, to providing coupons to save me money! Breakfast: Average breakfast, I enjoyed my juice, coffee and yogurt with my toast. The eggs tasted funny and were undercooked each morning. For a high quality dinner meant to impress clients, we really enjoyed Via Veneto Restaurant, look it up online! Problems: Beware of purse snatchers on mopeds, iPod thief's on the sidewalks etc. We were attending a conference at the Hotel Arts Barcelona next door and there were 4 people from our conference (900) who were robbed in the 5 days we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful staff; great location; great for business also - free wifi, printer access etc. And excellent breakfast, too. A great package in a city that has it all.................................................................

Reviews.Title: “Location was the best”
Reviews.Author: Lienfin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights after the end of a cruise. The hotel was reasonably priced and in a great location, within walking distance to many restaurants, casino, beaches. we found a nice little cafe just outside next to the hotel where coffee, water and breakfast was a lot cheaper. We got on the hop on - hop off bus right there. They have an amazing roof top pool that we spent a couple of afternoons on. There is a bar up there and you have a great view of the ocean. They don't know how to make a dirty martini there so don't order one of those. We had a great time in Barcelona - lots to do there for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: stelfe2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and toured around bercelona after our trip from grand canaria. The hotel is very classy all from the reception to the rooms. There's always someone by the entrance waiting to open the door for you and taking your luggage to your room after you check in. Our room was very cozy and elegant, airconditioner was good, the lighting was great, modern amenities were available i.e ironing board + flat iron, hair dryer, flat screen Tv and water boiler. The bathroom was very practical, had a shower and a bathtub as well. sandals and robes were available The breakfast was great, we enyoyed it. The service was great, they let you know when they are soon clearing the breakfast session so that you could get whatever more you would like to eat before they closed. We didnt eat lunch nor dinner at the hotel, so i have no comment about those meals. Just outside the hotel is a bus-stop which is great coz if you take the bus to the hotel and get off, the hotel is right there! Plus the metro is also close by, so that is a plus. The hotel is located near the beach (don't know the name), there's also a promenad by the beach where one could take a walk and also take pictures. The hotel is very clean, feels fresh, the reception attendants are friendly and professional... all in all i couldn't find anything faulty to say about this hotel, so anyone wants to take the plunge to visit and stay at this hotel... i recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Pullman Skipper Hotel,Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant hotel in good location. Breakfast/lunch wonderful selection. Evening meal choice limited. Swimming pool opening times restrictive as unable to visit due to times of seminar. Conference facilities ideal for our requirment. Bathroom etc facilities excellent.. Staff very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Lester519
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the beach near all the beach/pier restaurants, bars and and shops. Pullman provided fantastic service. Two great pools - one roof top. The beackfast is pricy but you can walk down the street one block and find breakfast at normal prices.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, close to beaches”
Reviews.Author: SavannahLady2010
Reviews.Content: I was here on a conference. Wonderful hotel with gorgeous roof top pool. Service is exemplary, and you are a quick walk to the beach. The rooms are large, clean and very nice. Ask for a room that overlooks the pool for quiet. There is nothing I would say that is negative about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous beach hotel”
Reviews.Author: welovetotravel09
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in August and absolutely loved this hotel. The rooms were very modern and stylish and we had a great view of the sea. The rooftop pool has an anazing view of the sea, beach and the fish sculpture (better than the arts hotel) and has a real party vibe. The pool area does get crowded but because most people are sightseeing while here beds do come free pretty quickly. The best thing about this hotel is the location - next to the beach and near to all the great bars, restaurants and clubs for the evening. It is a half hour walk to barrio gothic area, so is perhaps not the best choice if you only going to Barcelona for a few days but is great if you want a few days sunbathing as well as a few days sightseeing. Our only complaint is the price, however if you can book on a special offer deal which includes breakfast like we did, then it makes it more affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Splurge a bit - it's worth it”
Reviews.Author: wolfman50
Reviews.Content: Pullman Skipper is a top class hotel with a staff that does its utmost to justify a great reputation. It certainly isn't cheap, but I doubt that this is the most important element that one looks for in the Pullman brand. On the other hand, it is no more expensive, and often cheaper than similar class hotels in Barcelona with less to offer. It is worth shopping around on the net for deals, but we got the best offer in direct correspondence with the hotel. So if accommodation is important to you, then splurge a bit on the Pullman Skipper - it's worth it. The hotel has everything going for it. It is a modern, very well kept property, with every amenity you could think of. It is located next to the wonderful Barcelona beachfront and within 20-25 minutes leisurely walk from the central tourist areas, either along the beachfront promenade or down the pedestrian friendly streets. If you're in a hurry, a mainline metro station as well as bus lines into the city are close by. The rooms are sumptuous and very spacious. We figured that 4 could easily sleep on the gargantuan and extra comfortable bed. Bathroom facilities are of the highest quality and as at all Pullmans the toiletries are the best. The staff is friendly and consistently helpful. A problem we had with the AC was attended to immediately and housekeeping had the bathroom (where the AC unit was accessed) re-cleaned as soon as the repairmen had left. The rooftop pool area was immaculate and has great views. While we were there some guests were "horsing around" and doing belly flops into the pool, splashing other guests. This is against the posted rules and it would have been better if a hotel staff member had intervened rather than leaving it to a guest to calm them down. One final comment, although the breakfast buffet was delicious and had a wide range of dishes available for every palate, there were no vegetables at all. We are aware of Spain's carnivorous orientation, but, at least for us, breakfast is not the same without fresh seasonal vegetables. Vegetables aside, the Pullman Skipper is a very good, highly recommended choice in Barcelona and we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, nice staff and welcoming The room is neat and tidy, excellent bathroom Sure I get back in the future!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! it was very good holiday!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “not as far out as i thought”
Reviews.Author: ArmaghApple
Reviews.Content: pamper yourself - this hotel is beside the beach and beside bus and metro to take you into the centre. breakfast was excellent - very relaxed atmosphere. the bar in the evening was just as welcoming and relaxed for a drink after a day away. the rooftop pool and bar i did not sample as the weather was not up for it. the spa is worth a visit. good internet facailities. hotel caters for business and families.

Reviews.Title: “Missing some details to be very good”
Reviews.Author: kmeuleman Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: As I usually visit accor hotels on my trips, I somehow had an expectation before entering the hotel. I was looking for some pampering in the form of some wellness. Nothing defined, a massage, sauna, a swim, ... They told me the swimming pool was heated, but it felt like 20°C. Not really what I was looking for. To use the wellness area, it was 25€ or a treatment from the list. The treatments would take more than an hour. More than what I could spend at that time. So was 25€. So I went for a warm shower. Unfortunately the door of the shower was not closing completely, resulting in a lot of water on the floor. Not used to see these details missing.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Quality & Location”
Reviews.Author: CarolRed
Reviews.Content: Been to Barcelona a few times, stayed at this hotel for the first time. Wow - this place is nice. This is a quality place. Our rooms were superb - everything you would expect from a 4* hotel and this is a good 4* (we have stayed at other supposed 4* hotels and the Barcelona Pullman Skipper puts them to shame). Hotel is luxurious, fittings and decor excellent. Bedrooms, bathrooms, dressing gowns, slippers and toiletries all luxury. Large flatscreen tv with lots of channels. Mini-bar (pay extra). We even had a (side) view of the sea. Breakfast was simply delicious - a full range of all the breakfast items you could wish for. Hot, cold, fresh fruit (excellent choice), drinks. Huge selection, far too much to list, but all quality and you really couldn't wish for more. As you would expect, staff are also excellent - professional and helpful. My brother used the pool and jacussi (even in February) and said it was lovely. Location was superb - right by the marina and beaches. Some excellent restaurants nearby - some of our group loved the fresh seafood available. Main bus routes and the city tour buses run right outside. This hotel is everything you could hope for in a top quality 4* hotel. I would not hesitate to recommend this place and we would definately return. The only negative was that the bar was pricey, but you couldn't really expect it to be cheap! We didn't eat in the restaurant apart from the superb breakfast, but it looked good.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: Flint5oh
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Pullman Barcelona Skipper for three days prior to a cruise and really enjoyed the location and the hotel itself. The hotel is a short block to the sandy beaches of Barcelona and the many shops and snack places along the boardwalk. As you exit the front door the local city bus stop is a short walk. The hotel itself is very well maintained with a helpul staff. There is a great rooftop pool but you need to experience it early as it closes at 6pm, which was a disappointment. The hotel is a little pricey but you're really paying for location.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York City, New York, USA
Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ryejaz Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Loved the beach location and the staff was amazing. The only thing I would suggest is the pool/jacuzzi area staying open later. The elevator sign said 8pm but it was really only open until 7pm. Would have loved to have enjoyed the roof-top jacuzzi even later than that! Other than that, the concierge, the waiters, bartenders, housekeeping -- all amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Neat Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Brian C
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a treat, rooms were unique and modern. The bed was comfy and we had a great balcony with a view of the pool and the sea. The wi-fi in the rooms didn't have a great signal, which was my biggest complaint. The hotel had packages online with breakfast included which was cheaper than the base rate! The hotel has some good resturants close by and the main casino blocks away if you like to gamble. For the money, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I'm Now a Pullman Barcelona Skipper Fan”
Reviews.Author: limajt91279
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about booking a hotel outside of Barcelona’s city center but I’m glad I did. This hotel was a great respite from the hustle and bustle of Barcelona after a day of sightseeing. Upon my arrival to Barcelona’s airport I took a cab to the hotel, which couldn’t have been more than 15 to 20 minutes. The staff greeted me warmly (despite the occasional stare…I doubt they get a lot of African American customers) and quickly got me checked into my room. The staff, who all spoke decent English, was affable and knowledgeable of the surrounding area. The area is the selling point. The hotel is a block from the beach and I took full advantage of its proximity to the water and great restaurants (try Bestial). I booked a room with two single beds. It was enough space for me and my travel companion. The bathroom was nicely appointed and clean. There was this odd door between the room and the hallway. Not sure of its purpose. The rooftop pool is great (the pool on the ground floor wasn’t open). Breakfast was included with our booking and it was top-notch. I set the alarm on my phone each day so that I wouldn’t oversleep and miss the variety of food available. If you are looking for hotel in the middle of a lot of activities, this isn’t the place for you. But if you want a nice hotel near the beach, close to the metro (Ciutadella Vila Olimpica), book the Pullman Skipper.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern yet industrial vibe”
Reviews.Author: Diane M
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a weekend and had a mixed experience. On arrival we were greeted by very friendly staff and were helped with our bags to our room. First impressions was that the hotel decor was quite unusual, modern yet but the slated floor, concrete pillars and deep red walls didn't really match the 5 star image we had anticipated. The bedroom was a deluxe room but was no where near the size of those advertised on their web page. Having said that, the room was spotless, the bed amazing and the bathroom was gorgeous. The concrete wall in the bedroom, however, gave a very cold impression.The view was looking onto the busy highway so ask for an ocean view bedroom! The breakfast buffet was fabulous and gave a wide range of foods to choose from and the coffee was very good. Both the pools on the ground floor and rooftop were great and I'd definitely recommend the cocktails at the bar by the pool...fantastic mojitos. The reception was great at showing us how to get around the city and you can buy tickets at a discount price at the desk which was great. Can get the tour bus just up the road from the hotel. The hotel is less than 5mins walk from the beach and all the popular nightclubs. No problems checking out and were able to leave our bags there in storage afterwards until our flight home that evening while we had our final wander around the city. Lots of conferences were taking place at the hotel at the time so didn't have the holiday feeling to it but the service was commendable, had great nights sleep and a wonderful breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: CathyB184
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night at the start of a cruise, and thought this was a great hotel. We only had the lowest level of room, but it was large, very well appointed and very clean. The staff were really helpful and spoke very good English . The view from the roof top pool and bar is amazing. We did have a slight problem with the keycard for our room as none of them would work, but the staff did everything they could to help until it was sorted ( 8 keys later!!) I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: brswizz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 1 block to the beach (which really is a resort vacation quality beach). Also along the beach is a walking path with both smaller ice cream shops and some very nice bars/restaurants. 1 block the other way is a metro stop on the L4 line which takes you right to the Barri Gotic (and isnt the typical tourist line which means it is safer). The hotel is very nice and the rooms are big.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights in the Pullman Barcelona and a lovely stay it was. Reception staff were most helpfull and welcoming. Room was clean and a nice size bathroom too. Breakfast was good with plenty of choice. Location was perfect for us as we like to walk along the sea front 30mins and your at the base of La Ramblas. Nice little bike hire shop on the beach take your bikes as Barcelona has plenty of cycle routes I think we paid 9euro's for 2 hrs lock's included. We will look to go to the same hotel some time next year as Barcelona is a wonderful city to explore or if you like the beach there's mile's of that.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is great, staff not really!”
Reviews.Author: 13Vivi13
Reviews.Content: Hotel facilities were great, breakfast with a lot of varieties, room clean and with great amenities. However, the front desk not so great..we arrived and stood a few meters from the counter waiting to be called, nobody acknowledge our presence, literally ignoring us. When asked by late check out, the clerk simply read what was written what was on their reservation info, ignoring our question and replying in very rude manners.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - shame about the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: LloydyG
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nicely situated on a main road just one block away from the Barceloneta Beach and Port Olympico. There are plenty of buses and taxis near to the hotel, and there is a Metro station opposite (albeit you have to cross all the lanes of the main road to get there). I was told that the Rambla/Placa Catalunya were only a 20 minute walk away ... maybe if you're an Olympic athlete that may be the case ... it took me a good 35 minutes!) Check in was quick and pleasant, and the Reception staff are extremely helpful. Free Wifi was available The room was not overly large - but was well equipped and comfortable with a nice bed and a balcony which overlooked the pool/restaurant with views (6th floor) towards the copper "fish" in the Porto Olympico. The "attic" pool and sun deck was very nice ... free towels are provided and is a fantastic sun trap with great views. Alas - the restaurant was disappointing. Like many 4* hotels - it likes to offer "haute cuisine" (ie small portions at astronomical prices) ... and at 2100 I was the only person eating at the hotel (they gave me a €15 voucher) - the whole place was in darkness and I had to ask someone at Reception if the restaurant was actually open!). I'd much prefer it if they would offer alternative types of meals ... however - there is a less expensive cafe right next door to the hotel which offers much better value (but more "basic") food. The buffet breakfast was no more than average (food was lukewarm) - but there is plenty of choice and the coffee is very nice! Would I stay there again? Yes (now that I know the drawbacks are the distance from the city centre and the expensive restaurant) ...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GC61
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pullman for 3 nights to celebrate my 50th birthday. We arrived around 11pm to learn that we had been upgraded to a suite. The suite was superb and overlooked the ringroad. However, we had booked a room with a terrace. We asked to be changed (we're from Ireland and don't get much chance to sit outside in pleasant temperatures!) and the hotel obliged the next morning. The double room was fine if quite a bit smaller than the suite. We had breakfast in the hotel on all three morning. The buffet was excellent with a great range of fresh fruit and breads. There are 2 swimming pools in the hotel. The rooftop pool which has great sea views is smaller than the first floor pool. We used the first floor pool during our stay and the beds at the rooftop pool are occupied very early and there are more beds and some nice shaded loungers at the first floor pool. The desk staff are vey friendly. However, the breakfast staff in the restaurant seem to have very little English and are a little less friendly. As a bonus there are a couple of 'free' internet PCs, with printer connection which you can use and print your boarding passes for flights as necessary. The only downside to the trip was having my credit card wallet stolen, from one of the front pockets of my trousers, whilst going to the city centre on the underground train. I know there are many warnings about this but do be careful. I was one of those people who thought they were reasonably streetwise and that it wouldn't happen to me! Overall a fantastic hotel to which I really look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Good Barcelona base”
Reviews.Author: David777
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business conference in August - most annoying seeing all the other guests in T-shirts and shorts whilst we were looking at Powerpoint slides! Very welcoming reception staff and good quality breakfast buffets. Dark wood in the bedrooms made the rooms rather gloomy though and I found the set business lunch exceedingly slow - 1.5 hours when really we only needed a quick 45 minute break. Food at the hotel good but surrounded by some excellent restaurants. Noisy neighbours didn't contribute to a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Artistlin
Reviews.Content: There were 3 of us traveling together: my husband and myself and our 16 year old daughter. When the hotel realized that the room they had put us in could not accommodate a rollaway bed, they did everything they could to make it right. The put us in a room to use until a larger room could be made ready, helped move all our luggage to the new room, and checked to make sure that everything was alright. The hotel itself is beautiful, with fabulous furnishings. It's a short walk to the beach and boardwalk, taxis were easy to catch outside the hotel to more distant points. It is also near public transportation and a not so long walk to the Gothic part of town. I will stay here again the next time I come to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel; go back definitely”
Reviews.Author: Karin1
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed with a smile by the lady at the reception(Anne Louise) and though we were early, she had a room ready for us. Unfortunately we needed a doctor, but he was in our room within the hour. Location is great; near the beach and only 20 minutes by taxi from airport. Loved the breakfast buffet; staff very attentive. The rooftop pool is great; the music was a bit loud but we will definitely go back; we hope within the year!

Reviews.Title: “Blown Away By This Hotel! A Total Gem Seconds From The Beach In Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Mark_Moran
Reviews.Content: We loved every minute of our week long stay in the Pullman Skipper! It had it all and the staff were truly amazing. They were at all times friendly and attentive and so relaxed, not an inch of snootiness to be seen at all like in some 5 star hotels! The room was large and spacious, had a huge bathroom with a bath and separate shower. The breakfast was to die for, one of the most impressive I have seen in any hotel. Did I mention the fabulous rooftop pool and sun bathing deck with panoramic views of the Barcelona coast line and the city? We spent a lot of time up here and the staff looked after our every need. If you do go to the rooftop deck make sure you try the burger as like everyone has said previously it’s yummy yummy! The music on the rooftop deck added to the overall chilled out feel and anytime we wanted to go to the beach instead that was only seconds from the hotel. Not only that but there were a number of restaurants that we had food in right on the beach literally less than 5 minutes from the hotel (Carpe Diem Lounge Club, Shôko, Barcelona Ice Bar). I wish I could say everything was perfect but there were a few tiny things we were disappointed with….. we do love to gym a little bit when away on long trips but this was not really possible at the Pullman Skipper. I would have called what they had a fitness room rather than a gym with a few small bits of equipment and we were disappointed about this. The other thing was the WiFi in our room, it was in one word TERRIBLE! The signal was weak all the time and the system they used where you had to log back in every time via the browser was very annoying. I suppose I could have lived with it if the signal was good but in only one place was the signal strong and that was at the door to the room and I did not want to sit there on the flooor to browse the web. At the provided desk it was almost impossible to get a signal both on my Android phone and on my partners iPad. Speaking of a weak WiFi signal the rooftop deck had a bad WiFi signal as well. Lots of people had iPads and iPhones etc. on the rooftop deck as it’s nice to be able to browse when chilling out but again the signal was so weak more often than not it was a chore to try and even connect. Aside from the few gripes I had above I would highly recommend this hotel to family and friends who were travelling to Barcelona and wanted a nice place to stay close to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Koter
Reviews.Content: Nothing to complain about with this stay. Great hotel as it is walking distance to the old town where you will find the best restaurants and night life. The hotel offers two pools and a great lounge and breakfast. The gym is small but good enough. The rooms are amazing with all the perks you would expect in a 5 star stay. The walk across the beach is a non issue, we chose to stay at the hotel as the 2 pool atmospheres we meet your needs whatever they are. Worth the extra dollars.

Reviews.Title: “You just simply can't go wrong with Pullman hotels”
Reviews.Author: ewa55555
Reviews.Content: You just simply can't go wrong with Pullman hotels. We stayed at Pullmans in different parts of the world and it has always been nothing but excellent and great value for money. We arrived to Barcelona after spending few days in Venice, in rather average hotel for what it was priced and we have been really happy to stay in Pullman. Pullman Barcelona Skipper is located in the Olympic harbour just few seconds walk from the beach. The rooms are modern and clean with sea and swimming pool view. There are two excellent pools in that hotel, but one of the roof top is really worth visiting. It has a bar and absolutely stunning views.. The staff is very helpful and speaks excellent english. Another big plus of that hotel is very good breakfast with considerable variety of different foods to fit everyones taste. The only two little down sites to me personally are very slow lifts and not strong enough air-conditioning if you are used to standards like in Middle East. However, I would not consider this a big minus for the hotel, as those things vary across the regions.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, some of the staff superb!”
Reviews.Author: SRP1111
Reviews.Content: Located on Port Olympic near some nice beaches, my wife and I stayed here 3 nights and really liked this hotel. The room was comfortable and breakfast went on till late, a great help for late risers like us. Free wi-fi in the room was a good bonus! Some of the reception staff deserve a very special mention, especially Luis, who was fantastic. After we had got pickpocketed at Passeig de Gracia metro station at 11pm, and somehow found our way back to the hotel, Luis was superb - he helped us to no end in canceling credit cards, sending a maintenance guy to break open the baggage lock at midnight (as the keys of this lock went with the wallet), etc. In short, he tried doing whatever he could to help make us more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I visited Barcelona in early July and spent 5 nights at the Pullman Barcelona Skipper Hotel. We were very comfortable in a well appointed room. We had a room on the 4th floor which directly faced the sea (pity that there is a large building between the Skipper and the sea). Excellent breakfast in a most pleasant setting to start the day. 2 swimming pools available to guests. Easy access to and from the hotel by taxi, on the tourist open bus route and walking distance to the beach front with lots of super restuarants to chose from for dinner. If you would like to stay in a modern hotel just away from the inner city hubbub, this hotel is an excellent choice you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I arrived after an overnight flight from TLV so I was very tired, the reception crew did everything to make things move as fast as possible, the check in procedure was over in less than 2 minutes. After that I went to have some lunch at the hotel's restaurant where I had one of the best hamburgers I had ever eaten in Europe, great selection of food though the place it self is a bit overpriced. The room was perfect with awesome kit in the bathroom and with a very comfortable bad and with a nice terrace with view to the sea. About the location, the hotel is 10 minutes of bus ride from the "La Rambla" and 3 metro stops from the "Palaca Catalunya" and 2 minutes away from the beach, in other words great location, friendly and very helpful staff and a wonderful place, very very recommended!!! Gràcies Pullman Skipper!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near the beach”
Reviews.Author: blairegourmand
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Pullman as we wanted a hotel with a pool and the hotel 1898 was sadly fully booked. The Pullman is a quick cab of about five euros to the placa de catalunya I'm told there are bus and metro stops just near the hotel as well.the walk to la ramblas area is about 30 mins waking slowly. We liked that this hotel was so close to the beach as it's a side Barcelona we hadn't really seen before and you are out ofthe hustle bustle of la ramblas. The fitout of the rooms is slick and modern and ours had a view over to the beach and the pool area. The free wireless Internet was great. Bad points No driveway so when you get out of your cab you have to lug all your bags through the silly rotating door. The checkin counter was a bit sloppy. The breakfast was disgusting slimy smoked salmon, greasy inedible bacon, maybe powdered egg, toast was too thin and got stuck in toaster, we stuck to cornflakes and juice. They charge you five euro to bring ice to your room which we thought was outrageous. The aircon is pretty crappy. Notwithstanding the bad points we did enjoy the hotel and would recommend it to those looking for a reasonable value option away from la ramblas

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, clean and big rooms, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: MartinaMVienna
Reviews.Content: I can definitly recommand this hotel and would stay there again! A typical 4-5* city hotel, nothing to complain, everything as it is suposed to be. The check-in was fast, staff is friendly, rooms are quite big with a great view over the city or to the sea, nice bathrooms, classical breakfast buffet. The hotel has two pools, one on the roof, another one on the ground floor. Both are very nice, although a little small (but sufficient). The hotel is located near an underground station and only one block away from the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: BigDan72
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights for a business get together, so didnt have to pay for our stay, what was very good, because if the price matched the service, facilities, food and room my card would be maxed out. Will visit again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: dontdivedavedive
Reviews.Content: A great hotel for a weekend break. We thought the breakfast spread was excellent. Our room with a balcony and sea view was perfect and the sea breeze was lush. Everything was in good condition - smart bathrooms and good facilities. Only gripe would be crappy pillows and not the softest linen on the beds but i suppose one can always find something to complain about (or at least i can!) The kids with the families tended to stay downstairs in the lower pool area leaving the younger set (us) to chill by the more modern pool on the roof. The location was great as it's a minute form the beach and it's a short walk or cab into town. well recommended

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - nice location”
Reviews.Author: asbedi
Reviews.Content: 1. Location - located by the pier and a short walk from the underground metro station. The pier is a good place to go out at night (clubs etc) as well as for food. The rest of the city is well connected by the metro 2. Hotel - great service, nice food and great property. loved the bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Lynndy32
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Pullman Skipper prior to a cruise on Celebrity Solstice. The Hotel is in a fabulous position, two minutes walk from the Port Olympic (Beach) where there was an abundance of seafood restuarants and evening activities. The Hotel staff were fabulous, the room was ready even though we arrived at 12.30, after a lovely shower and freshen up there was a knock at the door and a bottle of fizz and chocolates compliments of the Manager, how fabulous. The room - Executive - was very spacious with a fabulous balcony overlooking the pool area with the sea view to the right. The bathroom, was absolutely huge. Previous reviews had mentioned that this hotel was geared up for professionals not tourists, we didn't find this at all, the front desk staff spoke perfect english and were extremely polite and professional. The breakfast buffet was one of the best I have ever seen, and we have stayed in a lot of top class hotels. If you want a busy city centre location then this hotel is not for you, there is no noise in the rooms, the location is perfect, with Las Ramblas about 5 minutes away. We were supposed to go sightseeing on the day before the cruise, but when we saw the rooftop pool, and the gorgeous weather we decided to stay there and chill, best decision we have ever made. The decor is modern and inviting, we absolutely loved this hotel, and have already decided that we will go back to Pullman Skipper even for a long weekend we enjoyed the hotel so much. Absolutely fabulous hotel and staff, we enjoyed every single minutes of our stay there, we can't wait to go back. Well done Pullman Skipper!!!

Reviews.Title: “Plush in a great location”
Reviews.Author: rapdc
Reviews.Content: Though one short block off the actual sand, the place has great beaches in both directions. If you don't want the beach, there's a very fine rooftop pool with views of the sea. There's also a nice cafe right beside it with good, affordable breakfast. It's not cheap, but very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Really impressed with this fab hotel near to beach & Marina”
Reviews.Author: MollyBee4
Reviews.Content: Staff were very friendly & helpful . We arrived early ( 10.30am ) and the room was not ready but the receptionist took our number & called the minute it was available . Rooms are really good. Spacious & well fitted. Bathrooms are huge with large bath & large walk in shower with clever door arrangements. Location was very good - we did one of the bus tours which starts a 2 min walk outside hotel. Reception constantly very helpful with good restaurant recommendation ( Barceloneta - excellent seafood but pricey ) & tickets to Flamenco ( we were treated like VIPs ) We mainly took taxis from directly outside the hotel to La Ramblas ( 5 euro ) Park Guell - a must c10 euro Rooftop pool & bar for a couple of hours after a busy walking tour was just a joy. Really enjoyed a ice cold glass of white wine in the jacuzzi - heaven !! Great tapas at Lolita - we tried to get in Bar Central in market for amazing looking seafood but too many queuing. All in all a fab weekend

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, great service, perfect for business travel”
Reviews.Author: Soda100
Reviews.Content: I was at the Barcelona Pullman Skipper Hotel for work, and it was a very comfortable stay. The hotel is modern, comfortable, spacious and luxurious. My room had a nice divider between the bathroom corridor which meant that if someone was showering, you wouldn't necessarily hear it. The bed was totally comfortable and since I am allergic to feather bedding, I had it made up in hypoallergenic bedding, which went fine. Super-fluffy towels, a huge soaking tub, all sparkling clean. The soaps are kind of musky and not to my liking, but good quiality. A flat-screen TV with European and many American cable channels meant there was plenty of entertainment. You have to pay extra for wireless access, though, but chances are if you can afford to stay here, you're either not paying or can swing that fee yourself. The room is really well thought-out, plenty of closet space and a roomy bathroom and enough seating in the room so that you can relax and not just be either on the bed or sitting at the desk. The restaurant here is top-notch, a wonderful breakfast, a combination of delicious Catalonian/Spanish warm and cold items, as well as classical breads, jams, cheeses, and meats. Great coffee and tea; service is attentive. We had a working lunch meeeting one day and the food was really enjoyable. Service at the front desk was very helpful: I was busy and wanted to have theater tickets reserved, and the concierge handled this quickly and professionally. The location of this hotel, however, is a little out of the way of immediate tourist attractions, however, it is located on a street busy enough where it's easy to get a taxi, but not too busy so that it's noisy around the hotel. When you get directions to the metro, everyone at the front desk tells you "it's behind that buiding over there" and it kind of is, just not super obvious. No matter, it's a quick walk and while the neighborhood is not especially populated, it seems safe and is in walking distance to the seaside, a couple of toursity but decent restaurants, and a small place next door where you can get breakfast if you don't feel like what they offer in the Pullman Skipper restaurant. There's a pool that I never got to check out, and exercise facilities, too, but I got plenty of exercise walking around Barcelona and enjoying the city. Overall, an extremely comfortable stay geared towards the business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: shakungifts
Reviews.Content: Hotel location too good .next to casino in front of beach staff very friendly and cooperative stayed there for 4 nights . food breakfast all great . think this is better than to stay in la rambla . opium good disco near by.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, ok location”
Reviews.Author: alisonandpaul1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Pullman Skipper (April 2011). Booked after looking at the Triadvisor reviews. Overall had a very enjoyable stay, though we would say that the hotel is more business orientated than for a city break. Although staying that we would return. Highlights are:- - Good location, not on La Rmablas, but then would you want to be? A block from the beach and had the benefit of giving us the option of visiting the beach as well as the city. - Great choice at breakfast buffet - Good sized rooms - Spotlessly clean Downsides - No concierge (if there was he was on holiday!) - Didn't seem enough check-in staff - Lighting in rooms is very poor (bring a miners helmet!!) - next door to a hospital so ask for a high floor to avoid too much noise disturbance Didn't eat in the restaurant apart from breakfast, so can't comment on the food quality for lunch or dinner, but as stated above breakfast was good. Overall positives outweigh the downsides.

Reviews.Title: “City Break”
Reviews.Author: DeviceNET Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good facilities at hotel. It was a pity that the lower pool area was closed off for repair but should be open soon. The roof terrace pool area was fantastic. Breakfast was very good with a wide variety offered. Room was clean and reasonably spacious. Location was good for beach, a little out of town, but close to metro line. Would stay here again if a promotional rate was available, not the standard fees.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Pullman Skipper - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Pullman Skipper Barcelona hotel is a perfect location to enjoy all Barcelona has to offer. Within walking distance or short taxi ride to historic neighborhoods, museums. beach dinning around the corner. All staff from the doorman, front desk staff, service staff are of superior caliber. Be sure to enroll as an A/club member to enjoy extra points for future stays at Accor properties all over the world. This was my second stay at the Pullman and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wozasmith
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel online from Australia for a one night stopover. We were not disappointed, this hotel is excellent. We requested an upgrade to a room with a seaview and were not disappointed. We had a king sized bed which is important to us and the bathroom was spotless. We had room service which was delicious. My husband likes to indulge in a very dry Gin Martini or two and vistied the bar where he was served by Fabio the barman, he said he made the best Martini that he'd had in our whole 8 week trip, plus Fabio was a wealth of information in regards to which brands of Gin made the best Martini and G & T's. At the hotel there are 2 pool areas, the ground one is in a lovely setting and there is a roof top one as well. Our only regret is that we couldn't stay longer :o)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near Port Olympic”
Reviews.Author: Gamaliel71
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel near Port Olympic. Value for money. Near the beaches and wonderful dining nearby. Rooms are clean and well equipped. Sinks with 2 taps. Rain showers. Thermostatic mixers. LED lights. Superb mood lighting for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel and Good Food”
Reviews.Author: freetraveller82
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights during our visit to barcelona. The hotel was great and the staff were very friendly and cooperative. We stayed in a Superior Room with a Queen size bed and terrace overlooking the sea. It was really breathtaking and the rooms were really quiet and we had a good sleep. The only thing I would complain about is in terms of the cleaniness of the room. We do not smoke and when we wanted to sit around in the terrace we saw an uncleaned cigarette budd which was disappointing. Also not very good was the quality of the bathroom atleast in the room we were staying. The shower leaked the water and it was overflowing outside the shower which wasnt very pleasant at all. Otherwise, we really liked the food (breakfast and dinner) and the resturant staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Some negatives but would definitely stay there again when we go to barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: DeVlieger
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, but only when the weather is good. Location is perfect near the beach and nice hip & trendy beach clubs and restaurants. Metro station only 100m which brings you within minutes to the city centre (Ramblas/Plaza Cataluna). Walking about 15-20 minutes. Nice clean rooms, great sunroof with swimming pool. The breakfast is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Clarry_13100
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, about 15-20 minutes walk from La Ramblas (or there is a metro station just a couple of streets away). There are some lovely bars and restaurants in the area. The staff couldn't have been more helpful, and little touches like a welcome bottle of champagne in the room on our first night really made our trip special. We had a room with a balcony, there is a lovely view of the swimming pool and the sea, and it was the perfect place to relax after a day of walking. The bathroom was also very impressive, all in all a fantastic stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: tbrundin
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six nights and had a wonderful time. Nice comfortable room, although not very big but with a wonderful view of the pool and the sea and beach. The optional breakfast was excellent, with a vast selection of various things to eat and drink. Staff was very helpful in supplying suggestions of what to do and how to get to different places with Bus or Metro/Tram. Just a short walk to the nearest Metro station We'll be back Tommy

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stephgardiner
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very trendy, loved the bathroom which was utterly luxurious:) large tv and comfortable bed. Breakfast was good too. Staff were extremely helpful with advice and hints on getting around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Nikospal
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location, very nice rooms, would stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Fabolous Service”
Reviews.Author: Pandabarney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights as we were going to the stadium to watch a match. The room was spacious with a large bed, tv, seating area and a large spacious bath, shower, toilet and double sink in the bathroom. Breakfast buffet was good, with lots of choice of both cooked and cold food. The location was good for the beach and marina and about a 10 minute walk to the underground train station. Staff were helpful and provided us with maps and info to get around. The hotel is about 20 mins from Las Ramblas but it was nice to be away from the hustle and bustle of city life.

Reviews.Title: “Very confortable and nice hotel. Very well located and exceptional view.”
Reviews.Author: dominique_boulenger
Reviews.Content: A very nice stay in this hotel. 2 swimming pools with a very nice design. Very good diner with a long wine lists. Breakfast was also great. An exceptional hotel both for business or leasure.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel - very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: WeekendGuest
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in December - hotel does not disappoint. Part of the Accor and certainly up to the standard. Rooms are clean and comfortable and very good value. Breakfast buffet is very good - better than other hotels that I have stayed in in Barcelona - a much wider choice and a Nespresso machine so you can make your own coffee. Bar is nice and food offering good as well Most of all the reception staff were very friendly and helpful. When we were there, London was snowed in and we were worried we werent going to be able to get home - they were extremely kind and accomodating Would certainly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at its best”
Reviews.Author: lotus1241
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! The hotel itself is stunning and has amazing facilities, it is spotlessly clean and the staff are fantastic. Everything about this hotel was wonderful, including the breakfast. The location offers everything - you wake up to a sea view, a short walking distance to the best restaurants either by the Marina or by Prot Vell, and is ideal to exploring all the sights. If I go back to Barcelona I will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Dale L
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for three days last year. It was outstanding. We loved it, stunning hotel, fantastic staff. I'f you're staying here be sure to have breakfast in hotel, it's fab!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a big event”
Reviews.Author: Toltriaco
Reviews.Content: Attended a large conference at the Pullman - I found the rooms to be very nice, clean, modern. The service was good and the facilities for such a large group were excellent. They even managed to pull off a sit-down dinner for 300 that was both hot and tasty. Impressive. The location is also nice, near the beach, just on the edge of the Barri Gòtic

Reviews.Title: “Great location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: donsyb
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as we wanted a hotel with sea views - and these are surprisingly few in Barcelona! This was one of the few hotels which would guarantee a sea view - however this is somewhat limited by an office block between the hotel and the sea front. They claim to be 5*, but I would rate it as 4*. Rooms are very nice, and the hotels style is very modern - typical of many hotels in Barcelona. Breakfast was average for a hotel of this type - selection was good, but not replenished when items ran out. The main issue was noise at night. We were not in a street facing room yet could still hear a lot of street noise, and people seemed to congregate for a party in the alley behind the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Xavier1972
Reviews.Content: A great Stay at the Pullman in the lovely Barcelona. Booked a room with balcony facing the swimming pool, good views at day and very nice atmosphere at night. To destacate the buffet breakfast and the front desk recommendations very helpful. Barcelona, I will come back again!!!

Reviews.Title: “super hotel”
Reviews.Author: t2tony
Reviews.Content: rooms were excellent location superb 2 mins to the beach, food and drink very good as were the pools would reccomend to anybody,staff were very helpful and polite

Reviews.Title: “GOOD TO AN ICY POINT!”
Reviews.Author: Froggy92121
Reviews.Content: Was great until I was told that a bucket of ice I requested will be charged as an "extra charge" of $5. I am staying a full week for about $1,500, talked to the Reception, but, nothing change their mind. Don't think about putting ice in your cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: lp27Cinci
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for part of our honeymoon. The suite we stayed in was incredible. Beautifully furnished, spacious, and accomodating. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Easy access to the beach! The rooftop pool is private and relaxing as well. Although this is not immediately close to the "main attractions" of Barcelona, the subway is a short walk away and can take you to most any attraction you wish to see. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the only reason to book here. Terrible service, mediocre hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ktlyne24
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay on the beach in Barcelona...like, literally on the beach, less than 50m from the sand and sea...then this place is just fine. But the hotel experience itself was among the worst we had in a 2-week trip to Spain. The hotel bills itself as a 5-star hotel, but doesn't live up to the expectations. 5-star to me connotes amazing service, and the Pullman Skipper provided the worst service of our entire trip. When we arrived to check in (coming from the Hotel Miramar on Montjuic, which was amazing), we were informed that there was a problem with our reservation and that we were being moved to another 5-star hotel in the city center-- which was not why we had booked the hotel. It was the location on the beach that we wanted, and when we informed that man at the desk that we were unwilling to move, especially after we prepaid for the room, he got agitated and said he had to speak to someone in reservations. He walked away for over 10 minutes, during which time we watched at least 5 other guests check in without issues. Upon his return, he told us we would be able to stay there, but his demeanor and tone was not only rude, but condescending. The rooms are fine. Not 5-star quality, but fine. Our 2nd floor room was right over a busy highway and busstop, so it was incredibly noisy at night. (To contrast, we stayed in Plaza de Santa Anna in Madrid, one of the noisiest areas of the city, and the hotel had double-paned windows that led to some amazing sleep.) The shower leaked and the bathroom's strange layout made it tricky to share. The hotel wi-fi only works on one device at a time, meaning that we could only use one iPhone to check emails-- a huge misstep for a hotel that promotes itself as business-friendly and something we heard other guests complain about. And the front desk staff was continuously unhelpful-- the hotel directory indicated that they could point us to banks, but when we asked, they couldn't answer the question. The location is the only reason to book this hotel, as it was right on the beach and made that part of our trip enjoyable. But if you care about the room, the service or a broader experience (or, frankly, doing other things in Barcelona, since it's about a mile from the start of La Rambla and quite a hike from other landmarks and most restaurants), then stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: type-r04black
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel or 4 nights in August 2010. Everything about this hotel is 5 star and is a def hotel I wold stay in again if i stayed in barcelona. Breakfast was lovely and catered for all people(very impressed). Hotel has 2 pools which were fantastic My only negatives were 1. No English tv stations 2. Mini bar was very expensive so avoid at all costs FYI - If you don't want to be ripped off with expensive meals then avoid the sea front! We paid 55 euros for 2 pasta dishes and 2 fizzy drinks!!

Reviews.Title: “A bit charmless but efficient!”
Reviews.Author: nroth
Reviews.Content: Strange title for an hotel review but this is exactly the feeling I had at Skipper. Barcelona is best known for boutique hotels and little gems in the old town and not that much (except Hotel Arts) large hotel chains with 100+ rooms. Pullman Skipper is ideally located at 50 meters from the beach between Port Olympic and Barcelonetta which makes it a great spot if you want to enjoy the beach and walk minimal distance when going back to the hotel. About the rooms: We had a a room with terrasse, view on the pool / garden. The room was quite spacious, the bathroom was spacious and modern design, very nice. Hotel facilities and service is good as well. Why charmless but efficient? Just because I can hardly think of anybody falling in love with this hotel but one easily finds him/her self very good in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super room and exceptional bathroom”
Reviews.Author: draff0107
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel. Very spacious, modern and comfortable room. The bathroom was the best I have ever seen. Well desgined, brand new with a big bath and a separate walk in shower. The location is great if you want to be near the beach but not perfect if you want the city centre. Then again it is very near a metro station (less than 200m) and the city tour buses go nearby too. A little bit of a noisy room with a street view was not ideal. Staff were nice enough- not overly friendly but decent enough.Also the restaurant had a limited menu and the food portions were a bit "snack" size- then again it is nouvelle cuisine I suppose. But the breakfast was pretty good. All in all a good spot and worth a look if the price is right. Oh there are two swimming pools-one small one on the roof- but limited shade up there (no parasols available!). The main pool was closed the weekend I stayed there so can't comment (but perhaps the hotel could have reduced our rate- but they didn't).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, fantastic location in a fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: alliebdive
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights after a cruise and loved it so much we would like to come back for a week or more. I'd done a lot of research on location and chose this hotel because it was close to a metro and we could be in Ramblas in about 10 minutes but without the noise of staying in town. Plus the hotel is 2 minutes walk to a super beach and the whole area around here in Port Olympic is full of all sorts of restaurants and bars from very typical Spanish ones in the older parts of town to super trendy bar/restaurants on the beachfront that are very reminiscent of South Beach in Miami. And it feels a whole lot more upmarket and secure than the downtown area. Service was superb from the moment of our arrival. The receptionist was very welcoming and helpful as was the bellman. We arrived early and our rooms were not ready but they stored our luggage, showed us where the pools were and where we could change and set up charging for us so that we could have food and drink. We found the rooftop pool to be extremely nice - no shortage of beds, plenty of shade and with a great couch lounging area too. The pool was just the right temperature. Our rooms (one classic, one superiour with balcony) were fabulous. Very large bathrooms with huge tubs, great shower and sinks, all super modern but very well done. The beds were very comfortable. All the towels including the pool towels were absolutely luxurious. The rooms had large flat screen tvs, tea and coffee facilities and a fridge. There was lots of storage. Wifi is available throughout the hotel and is free. In retrospect we would not bother with a superior room next time. There was no difference other than the balcony and really not worth any extra. My only gripe would be that the drinks around the pool were very expensive 4.50 euro for a coke etc but there was no objection to bringing up your own, there's a supermarket around the corner. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel, we got it at the cafe next door and it was very good. The beach was clean and well maintained and great for a swim. We ate at a very trendy place called CDLC on the beachfront in front of the hotel one night (sushi/fusion) and at a wonderful Spanish tapas restaurant about 10 minutes walk away called La Bombera too. We tried a couple of the club/bars - Opium, the Ice Bar and CDLC and they were all rather fab if a bit expensive ie 11 euro per drink. Still a great atmosphere and our older children (18 and 20) absolutely loved the area and we could relax knowing it was safe. Would thoroughly recommend this hotel and we will undoubtedly be back. A small example of good service at the end: The bell captain hailed us a cab which had to be quite a large one to take 4 people and their post cruise luggage!!! He got us one and then loaded it with the taxi driver but there was a problem with the shelf in that it would not close with the shelf in place. He took it away and stored it for the cabby to come back and retrieve later.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: frevagh12
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it was listed as 5 star and had leisure facilities including 2 swimming polls for my family. My children are 16 and 13 years old. This was a 2 night stay prior to going on a cruise.On the first evening we received a note from the hotel informing us that one of the 2 pools would be closed from 0900 to 2000 hours the following day to facilitate a private event. On our return to the hotel the following day we could not find any sun loungers or seats of any knid at the roof top pool. In fact the are was very over crowded. My wife and I went to speak to the female receptionist who had a couldn't care less attitude. I asked to speak to the Manager who just lifted his arms in a couldn't care less manner.This is not how one would expect to be dealt with by staff in a 5 star hotel.The hotel itself was very good including the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good facilities”
Reviews.Author: ChetanNewDelhi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is value for money, great location and excellent breakfast. Very close to beach(500 meters) and metro station(300 meters) I would recommand for people who go to beach and want some luxury

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: tinka2Essex
Reviews.Content: stayed 3 nights one night the corridoor on the 3rd floor stunk of drains apart from that nice place ( not 5 star more 4 star)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, with customer service issues”
Reviews.Author: twogaijins
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Skipper for 3 nights as my partner had a conference in Barcelona. What a disappointment. The hotel building itself is very new and has a beautiful pool courtyard and a view of the ocean, a rooftop pool with bar (which I never saw open) and very modern rooms (with balconies). However there were various aspects that just do not live up to their 5-star rating. The chambermaids were rude and would knock and immediately open the door twice catching me in a state of undress - instead of apologising and leaving immediately on one occasion she stood with the door open and kept asking when I was going to leave so she could make up the room! On another occasion a maid opened the door and when I shouted that the do not disturb was on I had to deal with 3 maids holding up the do not disturb saying I had it the wrong way around... this didn't make sense as on both sides it indicated that they should not enter and there was a separate card for "Please make up my room".
