The bathroom was quite spacious and very modern. The only downside was that the shower and WC shared a common sliding door, which meant if one was in use the other could not be used. It also meant that once you had finished showering the water would run down the door and soak the floor. The breakfast was very disappointing. There was a decent selection of hot items but the pastries were a letdown. Overall the quality of the food didn't live up to expectations. The TV system in this hotel is not fit for purpose. The menu system is buggy and slow. On selecting a channel from the menu it would take you to another. A lot of channels were missing (just fuzzy/no signal), those channels we did have would 'skip' and the audio would chirp and pop making them unwatchable. Some channels were just not available (Sky News) - when I asked maintenance they just said it wasn't working and made no attempt to fix it. Most channels were German/Spanish. We were given complimentary WiFi but I do not know if this was due to the corporate booking. A username and password must be entered every time you connect which is annoying. The gym was abysmal. It's my understanding that it is being refurbished and so it's currently split over two guest rooms. It comprised of 1 set of rusty dumbells, one chest press, one leg extension, 2 benches, 2 treadmills (one out of order), one 'magnetic' cross trainer (no working display but useable), 4 bikes (all with broken or unchangeable seats making them unuseable). All of the machines had a home gym quality and were not what you would expect in a professional gym. Hopefully the new gym will be better. The hotel has a decent little business centre with 4 PCs, a Colour LaserJet, and Scanner. Printing is complimentary which was useful. As the hotel is on a busy road with only a small area for 2 cars to stop I found it very difficult to get taxis. Overall I didn't enjoy my stay at this hotel and would probably book into The W next time.

Reviews.Title: “PLEASANTLY SURPRISED”
Reviews.Author: EssexBarnes
Reviews.Content: Stayed a single night on business and as my title says, i and my clients were very impressed. I normally stay at The Arts, but on this occasion, due to lack of availability, the "club class" rooms were a little pricey. I always prefer to be close to Port Olimpico and the Pullman came up as a good option in the area. Due to some confusion with the booking agent we were all given upgraded deluxe rooms which were roomy, modern, spotlessly clean and well accommodated. Exceptionally comfortable bed and ultra modern bathroom, with a very strange sliding door that forms either a shower wall or a toilet wall / door. The only problem is that once you have had your shower and the door slides back, the water drips onto the floor in the toilet....but that really is only a small point. The reception is very bright and airy with very helpful staff and also a very pleasant outside seating area for breakfast. This hotel is literally around the corner to The Arts and minutes from the port and Barcelonetta. I shall definitely re-visit the Pullman for future business and personal trips to Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Close to beach, nice hotel, but some minor deficiencies”
Reviews.Author: socprof
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel located right next to the beach -- it's kind of like the poor relation of the Hotel des Arts. I have stayed here twice, under different management, and both times have been struck by minor deficiencies that took away from the general positives of the place. Examples include just one soap for both sink and shower, a leaking shower (both times in different rooms), a broken hair dryer, and no clock/alarm in the room. The cumulative effect is of a less than five-start hotel. A second major downside, as others have noted, is that it's a bit of a hike to the rest of the city, although there is a metro stop very close by.

Reviews.Title: “If you can get a good deal well worth a look”
Reviews.Author: JimiSheffield_UK
Reviews.Content: Hotel This is a bizzarely named stylish hotel in the Port Olimpic Area. It has a business slant to it but would also be good for people holidaying as well. Getting There The cheapest way is to get a T10 ticket at the RENFE station (Spanish Rail) at the airport. This entitles you to 10 journeys of up to 1 hour 15 minutes on the train, metro and bus and any combination of those. You can also use it for more than one person, you just need to time stamp it for however many people you are using it for. It costs 7.30 Euros and available from the metro stations. A Barcelona Card also entitles you to free public transport and can therefore use the RENFE to get to the town. After landing pick up you bags and follow the signs for RENFE, then get the train to Passieg de Gracia. Trains run every half hour and journey takes 30 minutes. Transfer on to Line 4 to La Pau and get off at Cituadella del Villa Olimpic (about 4 stops). The metro isn't particularly lugagge friendly and the transfer to the metro involves a walk of about 10 minutes with some stairs. Exit the metro then look for the two big towers (these are very useful for finding the hotel). Head towards the tower on the right (Hotel Arts), and the Hotel Pullman Skipper is 50m to the right. The whole journey takes about 1 hour. Other options to get there from airport by public transport are the Aerobus (which is not included in a T10 ticket or Barcelona card)which will drop you off in Placa Catalunya and the regular bus service. The Room We booked through Expedia and got a special deal on a Superior room, however we were intially put in a Classic Room. The Classic Rooms have a 'city view' (i.e. the Ring Road) and no balcony. The hotel explained that the expedia bookings come through to them as a booking for a Classic Room so be aware of this. They were happy to change our room when we showed our booking. I would definately recommend the Superior Rooms. We staying in one that faced the sea and which meant the balcony got a lot of sun in the morning. In the hotter months it might be better to stay in the east facing rooms as their balconies were shaded. The sea facing rooms were numbered 27-45 and the east facing 1-26. You'll only see the sea if you're on the fourth floor or above and the hotel has six floors. The grounds are very stylish and a pleasure to look at from the balcony. The bathroom was clean and spacious with a separate shower and large bath. A Flat Screen TV with some English channels and DVD player that will also play CDs are provided. The TV can be played through speakers in the bathroom. The Hotel also has a DVD rental facility. Location It is located in the Port Olimipic area about 100m from the beach. There are plenty of trendy bars/clubs around which double up as fancy restaurants e.g. Shoko, the ICE bar, Opium bar and CDLC as well as the more cheesy row of bars/clubs/restaurants in the port itself. The old town is about 15 mins walk away if you take the direct route past the gasnatural (butterfly) tower and a leisurely 30 minute stroll if you walk along the seafront and through Barcelonetta. All the main tourist attractions in Barcelona are spread evenly throughout the city and can be accessed easily by bus/metro but I recommend walking if you have the time. Check out the Parc de la Cituadella. The Zoo there is also worth a visit. The metro stop (Cituadella del Villa Olimpic) is 5 mins walk away and is on the line to barcelonetta (if you're lazy). A supermarket can be found in a shopping centre about 10 mins walk away in "El Centro de la Villa" on Google Maps. There is a cafe next door to the hotel which does breakfasts + sandwiches etc. Other facilities in the Hotel It has a gym and spa (which weren't open when we stayed, check the hotel website for more details) and 2 pools, one on the roof which is open all year round and slightly heated. There's also a jacuzzi on the roof. The main pool in the centre of the hotel is outdoor and open in the summer. The Syrah restaurant is open all day and is where you have your breakfast. Breakfast is good but nothing particularly special. We didn't eat there for lunch/dinner but reviews suggest the food good but the atmosphere is lacking. The bar is expensive for spirits (12 euros a time ouch) but you can get a beer for 4.50 and a glass of cava for 4.50. Room service has a minimum 5 euro charge as well. Wireless internet is also free throughout the hotel and is reasonably speedy Overall Would definately stay at this hotel again. Top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in nice location”
Reviews.Author: MarcLeuven_Belgium
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Skipper Pullman four nights over the New Year Period. The hotel is located along Passeig Litoral Mar and right in front of the pedestrianised beach area which is littered with little eateries and bars. At a mere 200 m from the entrance of the hotel is the Ciutadella-Vila Olimpica metro stop of line 4 giving you direct quick access to the more central parts of the city (passeig de gracia, gothic quarter, ...). The hotel is flanked by the Arts hotel on one side and by the Barcelona biomedical research center on the other side. The neighbourhood is very safe and pleasant to walk through. The rooms of the hotel are comfortable with high-quality linnen and upholstery in the rooms. The bathrooms are spatious and equiped with all modern amenities. The rooms also have a second (inner) door that provides extra insulation from possible corridor noises. The rooms basically come in two varieties : the exterior ones that face the streetside have no terraces and generally less light. Windows can't be opened either. The interior rooms face the garden/pool area of the hotel and give either a frontal sea view of sideway sea view. These rooms have terraces and have larger windows that can be opened. The breakfast is of a good standard. Staff is polite but does not ooze with personality or with attentiveness. Wifi is free and available everywhere in the hotel. The business center is likewise free of charge and available 24/24. All in all this is a very nice hotel of the Accor group that offers value for money. One default in the design of the rooms was the shower door which does allow a trickle of water to escape onto the bathroom floor when taking a shower. This could be easily remedied in my opinion though.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best hotel i've been.”
Reviews.Author: lffranco
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Barcelona's Pullman (or AB Skipper) like is also know for three nights. The staff was amazing, all of them friendly. When i checked in they upgraded my room to a better room (front to the sea). The hotel is near Barcelona's marina, and is 2 minutes walking from the beach. At night the pubs and bars are all in that area, what is great if you want to go to barcelona to enjoy the nightlife) The room had all the conditions to be a 5 star hotel, and there was a metro station very close to the hotel, from where you can go to any place in Barcelona. This hotel is highly recommended. (Sorry for my english)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but service can be better as a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel-w-Style
Reviews.Content: If you're going to BCN during summer its perfect location for the beach, its right on Port Olympic, not far from Port Vell, however, its a bit far from the city center, its def not a walkable distance. I found that the service is not all that great for a 5 star hotel, there were a few agents there were being a bit rude and uneasy to approach... It was my husband's birthday the day when we checked in, the front desk agent was very nice and noticed it, just about 15 mins later she sent a box of chocolate to the room... breakfast is exellent, can't ask for more, overall is great!

Reviews.Title: “WoW!! Modern and Stlylish...”
Reviews.Author: Narathip
Reviews.Content: We had a chance to try this lovely hotel during our return trip to Barcelona. From our initial check in at the reception through to checking out, we found the staff very helpful, polite and efficient. The room had every possible facility for your comfort and need, everything in the room was very trendy and uptodate. The hotel is located about 100 metres from the Metro which is only 3 stops to Plaza Catalunya and Las Ramblas area. We really love this hotel and would definately come back to stay here again sometimes in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: PandaMK
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in November & really liked this hotel. The location is great - 2 minutes walk from the waterfront , and 10-15 minutes from the Ramblas. The reception staff were helpful and friendly, rooms very comfortable with great showers, and breakfasts good. We had 3-day travel cards for the buses and metro, so used these a lot to get around. Several buses stop right outside the hotel and the nearest metro station is 5 minutes away. We didn't try the pools but the garden areas look really nice. You could have a perfectly good break staying at this hotel, but it is such a great city it would be a shame not to explore!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location ideal for clubs and bars in olympic/beach area.”
Reviews.Author: sunseters
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May for a 4 night break the hotel was amazingly quite! very few peole at breakfast each morning- which we liked. The position of the hotel is ideal if you like the funky bars clubs and restaurants on the beach. the top pool is great for a bit of sunshine and the jaccussi is fantastic. Very clean modern and funky but with a excecutive business feel combined. perfect for a city break. Free internet a bonus, great rooms and service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful 5* hotel”
Reviews.Author: kiershel
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel, couldn't fault it. Food and drinks are however expensive but you are staying in a 5* hotel so expect to pay above the average for a drink or sandwich. The ground floor infinity pool was stunning and the roof top pool was ideal if you wanted to get away from kids staying in the hotel. Its a deep pool so no kids are up there. Its also got an outdoor jacuzzi on the roof and the views are beautiful. The reception staff were superb and upgraded my 3 sisters and I to a suite, free of charge. Stunning!! The location is ideal for the beach lover and is right by the marina - 5 mins walk. If you fancy heading to Las Ramblas then you can walk it, it's a beautiful walk, in around 25 mins and we did it in high heels!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jclaesens
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here on our honeymoon in May. We had a very enjoyable stay. We couldn't praise the hotel and its staff anymore. Swimming pools where amazing as was bar and food. View from the balcony was wonderful. We felt we where in the heart of Barcelona but away from all the noise as such. Would love to return

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and Hotel BUT staff could've easily made it better”
Reviews.Author: Tahera
Reviews.Content: Well, we had a 3 night break at this hotel which has the best beach location in my opinion. It is a lovely hotel with great design and interiors. The rooms were a lovely size and very plush. The staff checked us all in fine speaking fairly good English. Outside the hotel is a cafe where we decided to have breakfast so all 6 of us sat down and on the table behind us sat a group of teenagers and then along on a bike was a man whose pedal fell off so we all kooked at him and unkown to us my cousin had her handbag stolen..basically we belive it was all a staged act..DO NOT UNDR ANY circumstance leave your bag on the floor/chair next to you beacuse IT WILL be stolen in front of yor eyes :( We asked at the hotel where the police station was and they had ni idead i thought that was very poor. We used a tour bus company their are two and we used the crap one! also remember if ur there for a weekend the shops are ALL SHUT on a Sunday. The Monorail is definately worth a visit. The hotel at checkout tried charging us for minibar but we had not used it then amazingly refunded that back to us..sneaky! remember to take your paperwork as they claimed my room was not paid for upfront when it had been and eventually they realised i had paid for my room. We flew into Girona which is about 1hr 15 min out of Barcalona the bus was 20 euros into town and then we took a taxi again go with a metered taxi as its the safest option and cheapest. Apart from that its a great weekend destination..weather was great and beach clean..

Reviews.Title: “simply the best”
Reviews.Author: cosInMayo
Reviews.Content: huge rooms spotless, massive en suite, constantly bieng maintained and cleaned on a saturday evening we seen 3 ladies on thier hands and knees washing the carpets on our floor chatting away as they worked, i hope they are getting a proper wage. highly reccomend this hotel, the facilitys are second to none

Reviews.Title: “Well located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paulohugo
Reviews.Content: For those that do not like the hustle and bustle of the City center experience this is a great hotel. Desk Staff are very helpful, or try to be. Swimming Pool on Roof is quite good and is always crowded and seating almost impossible to find. In downstairs bar a large variety of wines, cava and other alcoholic beverages can be found. At the rooftop pool bar drinks are limited through both mediocrity and choice. Beds are firm but comfortable. Bathrooms well appointed and modern. Rooms near to Main Street can be noisy. All rooms have plenty of closet space so ones room always looks tidy. Hallways are wood and very light. Lights can be complicated and do not always work. Where room safe was there was insufficient light and one had to use a flashlight to examine interior of safe when checking out. We took cabs everywhere. Very easy to find two taxis at a time. Excellent breakfast with lots to choose from. Dinner however is minimalist and maybe only worth doing if the heavens have opened up. Many good restaurants in walking distance in the Marina or beach. Check in and even worse Checkout can take a long time so make sure you plan for it

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Dundeetravellers_8
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 5 day break & our 6th trip to Barcelona. We thought we had seen most of Barcelona over the years so we thought we would try staying at the Port Olympic end of the city & just chill out. GREAT CHOICE. We have over the years done all the touristy stuff, Les Ramblas, Gothic area, all the museums etc etc, so a 5 day break just chilling was a change for us. The Pullman AB Skipper Hotel is idea to do this at. From the initial greeting at the front desk to our departure the staff were superb. They could not do enough for you. The rooms are superb & extremly clean. The pool areas & bars are kept imaculate & clean. There is never a time when the staff are not tidying up around the sun loungers. We really liked the Attic pool on the roof. Someone commented on the drinks being pricey, but to be honest it is just hotel prices & nothing REALY steep. The hotel is around 100mtrs from the front & you really cannot find a better hotel to chill out at. There are numerous restuarants & cafes in the area. Again slightly more expensive that the city back street outlets, but we found the food superb. We were taken with the food at one of the restuarants so much we returned the next night as the food was the best we had had in the city. "LA BARCA DEL SALAMANCA" It is situated in the Port Olympic Marina on the ground floor on the left hand side facing the sea. As for shops in the area they are scarce for everyday things. If you need papers, water,beer etc the only shop we found was also at the marina. Up the escalator onto the 1st floor beside GINOS Restuarant. We love Barca so we will be back again for sure. We will also be back at the AB Skipper Hotel. It may be out of the city a wee bit, but you can easily walk to Les Ramblas & the other marina area in 10-15 minutes. Again we both recommend this hotel to anyone. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel! Beautiful location! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Ihearttravel83
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel in a great part of town. We had a suite which had views of the marina and was very spacious. The hotel does not have a lot of personality but it is definitely plush and very comfortable. The roof top pool is lovely in the summer and the service is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A EVITER”
Reviews.Author: giovagigi
Reviews.Content: If no incident happens during your stay everything is fine (2cnd stay there) but if it occured that you encounter problems, nobody is there to attend your concerns - nobody takes responsabilities of your problem even the General Manager (something was stolen in my room). They make you think that they are dealing with the problem but in fact let you in the expectation with no follow up. When insisting to talk to someone I was hunged up on the phone by switchboard staff. AVOID !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel, great service and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jvdv
Reviews.Content: This is a thru 5 star hotel with excellent service. I can really recommend this hotel. It has very attentive staff. I had a great room (first floor 116), quiet, spacy, clean and very nicely decorated. This hotel has 2 great pools; 1 roof top pool with bar and 1 pool on the ground level. It is situated close to the Port Olympic, the Beach and Barcelonetta. So a great location. It is a great hotel for a combined city / beach vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stefoley
Reviews.Content: Well all we can say is that this is one serious hotel. The check in went without a hitch, the room was excellent and very well equiped. Thanks to other reviewers we had no problem finding the shower/wc!! Stay here and you will understand! The stay was most enjoyable. The best feature of the hotel for us was the Roof top pool. Staff are more than helpful. Changing Travellers cheques in the Hotel was simple. The food in the hotel is fantastic, breakfast is to die for!! The location of the hotel is great. Proximity to the beach is just great. Lots of little cafes and bars nearby. One thing, across from the Casino in Port Olympic, up the stairs there is a great shop were you will pick up all you littel day to day needs and is not too expensive at all. All in all we had a great stay in Barcelona, Again!!

Reviews.Title: “AB Skipper Ahoy!!”
Reviews.Author: gdiet
Reviews.Content: This is really a special hotel and we had the nicest experience. It may not have the "wow" factor that the neighbouring hotel Les Arts has but you will not be disappointed if you stay here instead. Things we loved about this hotel: 1. The service is amazing, from reception to bar staff everyone is exceptionally friendly and willing to tell you all about Barcelona. 2. The rooms are finished to a very high standard and not sure what the other reviewers are talking about the taps you just have to know how to turn them on. The turn down service was a bit of a surprise and could be annoying 3. As it was my boyfriends birthday I had emailed the hotel beforehand to ensure that we would have a room with a nice view and they upgraded us and provided complimentary cava and chocolate strawberries!!! Again part of the amazing service and attention to detail. Unfortunately we didn't get to experience the restaurant in the hotel as there a so many good restaurants to visit in Barcelona Argentinian Patagonia steakhouse is worth a visit! I really cant compliment this hotel enough, it was a great experience and will definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “Loved the AB Skipper”
Reviews.Author: JLennonLuton_UK
Reviews.Content: I was a bit dubious about not staying close to La Rambla for this trip, but was delighted that we booked the AB Skipper when we arrived. Staff were very pleasant throughout the duration of our trip and their English was superb. The only downside (or so I thought) was that the hotel isn't located directly on the beach. However, after we got settled in our gorgeous, clean room, this was quickly forgotten. Breakfast was superb and finishes at 11.30am on Sunday mornings. Staying at the AB Skipper felt more like a holiday than a city trip. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury by the sea”
Reviews.Author: Eidu
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our holiday in Barcelona and truly enjoyed hotel AB Skipper. The location is marvelous: you can enjoy the cooling breeze from the sea and still reach the city centre in no time. The metro station is right there (yellow line takes you 100 meters from La Rambla or alternatively take the yellow line to the opposite direction to reach a big mall) and touristic buss stops in the next block (take the buss in the morning and you’ll get a seat in the upper deck). Also taxi is very cheap (5€ from La Rambla to the hotel). In the beach boulevard there’s variety of restaurants, also some high-class choices. Also McDonalds and Pizza Hut are there. Bars and lounges can be found on the beach level. The hotel is very clean and comfortable. The atic pool is a gem: lots of sun beds and chairs and great views to the sea. The ground level pool is not so enjoyable, there are few sun beds and the sea breeze doesn’t get here. The were several computers that guest could use, free of charge. The gym has air conditioning and it has a decent amount of equipment, enough to get your daily exercise done. Service in the hotel was excellent. The front desk was always willing to help. Our room was marvelous. We had de luxe room and really appreciated the terrace that had a sea view. Since the terrace wall was all glass, the rooms felt very airy and spacious. The toilet was first class, with bath robes and slippers and high-class products. What was superb was the turndown service during which they also wiped the bath room floor and changed some towels. Breakfast had a variety of choices, we liked especially the fresh fruit, nicely peeled and chopped. Cava, red and white wine was there every day. I can’t think of any complaints. Some reviewers complained about the sirens. We spent five nights and only on Saturday night we heard sirens. The sound can be heard very clearly, so I understand that it can be annoying if it happens many times. I truly recommend this hotel to anybody who wants to have a memorably stay in Barcelona. The room price is high, I admit that, but you really get value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “We thoroughly enjoyed the AB Skipper and the friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: holidays001
Reviews.Content: We were not sure where to stay in Barcelona - particularly that this was our first time in this wonderful city. Fortunately we came across the AB Skipper - as it offered all the necessary requirements (close to the beach; gym, swimming pool(s); and internet). Amenities in the bathroom were appreciated. The choice of the teas were most welcome and made returning back to the hotel after an exhausting day something to look forward to. On arrival at the hotel we were allocated rooms on the 6th floor - overlooking the pool. This was ideal as there was very little noise from the street. The location to the beach, promenade was excellent, the metro around the corner and very convenient to travel to the centre of Barcelona. Most tourists tend to stay in the Ramblas area - but certainly would recommend anyone to stay at AB Skipper (Port Olympic). Close proximity to the nightlife of Barcelona and a choice of restaurants to choose from. We travelled with our teenage children who thoroughly enjoyed the hotel and to top it, the breakfast was delicious. Should we ever return to Barcelona there is only one place that we would return to. AB Skipper hotel and staff thank you for the memorable time we had in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Liveformyholidays
Reviews.Content: A modern hotel right by the Olympic harbour and two minutes from the beach. It's very comfortable and high standard, the restaurant excellent quality and reasonably priced. This hotel is near the metro and the stop for the open top bus and about 15 minutes walk to La Rambla (or in our case a 6 euro taxi ride). Great modern bathroom with all mod cons including decent powerful hairdryer, slippers, robes etc all the usual you would expect in a good hotel but don't always get. Hotel also has two very nice pools - would be a good hotel to stay in with kids because of this and proximity to beach. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Eccentric modern hotel, but good”
Reviews.Author: Eaden
Reviews.Content: I wasn't the only person in my work party who had an embarrasing story to tell when I checked in to this hotel - I just couldn't find the toilet - I knew it was hiding somewhere, but it was so cunningly disguised I almost had an accident. Finally found it lurking behind a sliding door in the bathroom (either the shower is open or the toilet!) Still, this is uber modern and chic and I am just a bit too much the wrong side of thirty. I also had a bit of a challenge getting out onto the balcony. And I was sober. Still, gizmos apart, this is a very elegant hotel. It's good for the conference centre area (a taxi ride) and is a little walk from the sea, but it is a bit out of town too. Very nice non alcoholic cocktails in the bar, a very good breakfast too.

Reviews.Title: “Ok experience... overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMx
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a corporate event... The hotel is quite new and is modern... the location for me is not practical because is away from all the action in Barcelona city center... its close to the beach, but not on the beach... the service was really good though... the room was massive! with a huge nice bed and a fabulous bathroom! they provide with loewe products that come very handy! I also loved the sliding door in the bathroom... the food in the restaurants was very "handsome", but not really tasty... Overall, for the hotel category and the price I would have expected something more... nothing was really wrong, but nothing was outstanding...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MH75
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel AB Skipper for one night and I wish I could have stayed longer, this is truly a contemporary and modern hotel, the rooms are comfortable with so many little extras. The bathroom is modern and chic with quirky design concepts, and the sliding shower door doubles up for the toilet door! The room had a very comfortable bed, mini-bar, bath robes, slippers, iron & ironing board, wardrobe lights up when you open it, digital safe to put your own pin number in and large enough to take my laptop!! There are cupboards with additional pillows and blankets if you need those extra comforts, adjustable plasma TV with information about the hotel, was even able to set my wake up call through the TV, obviusly many of the channels are in Spanish but who needs to be watching TV when the beach is only 2 minutes walk away? The roof terrace is beautiful as well as the spa, would definitely recommend taking a trip up there. Didn't actually get to eat in the hotel restaurants but the menus looked amazing. The beach front has some amazing places to eat as well some clubs, I ate at CDLC, trluy scrumptious food brought to you while you kick off your shoes and relax on one of the beds while relaxing music plays in the background, then later it turns into a happening club where the music gets louder and the people pile in. Another place of interest is Ice Barcelona if you fancy getting out of the heat for an icy drink!!! You are given hats, gloves, coats and scarves, apparently temperatures in there are -7 degrees and everything is made out of ice including the bar and your glass!! This is a truly great place to hang out and I would recommend Hotel AB Skipper, can't wait to go back in April!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable (but a little annoying) stay at the Skipper”
Reviews.Author: Crickett28
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Skipper for 4 nights this winter. It is truly a very nice hotel, but had some shortcomings for a true 5-star hotel. To sum up, if you are looking for a plush modern hotel with amenities near the water, then the Skipper is a good choice. However, if you are seeking a completely stress-free, no hassle, luxurious 5-star hotel (especially for the price), then I might look around a bit more until the Skipper fixes some of its teething problems. We were greeted by a young British girl who presumably deals with the English speaking guests. While very friendly, her way of highlighting the hotel's advantages was a bit odd, to say the least. Rather than pointing out local sights, restaurants, or transport, etc, she instead rhapsodised about the 'brilliant blow dryer' in the room, and pointed out in some detail the rather obvious features of the room (eg. 'this is a TV, this is the air conditioning). Gee, really? It would have been far more useful if she had instead pointed out that the taps in the sink would, without fail, splash a load of water all over the floor every time they were used. Or that sometimes there would be no hot water in the tub. As some previous reviewers have pointed out, you will need to read the guide to operate the tub! I will say that the shower itself was great, with good water pressure for Europe, even if it did leak all over the floor whenever used. The room itself was really nicely appointed - a big bed, comfy chairs/sofa, adequate desk, fully loaded minibar, loads of storage space, and we had a great view into the city. Lots of toiletries, although the very anti-environmental plastic packaging on every single product was a bit overkill. There is a snazzy coffee machine and kettle in the room, with lots of coffee and teas to choose from. I ordered room service for a late afternoon snack and the food was delicious. However, we found so many little things to be a bit annoying, which added up to a somewhat bigger annoyance. For example: - The bank of light switches for the suite gives no indication of what switch controls what light, and you will invariably wind up turing them all off and on several times before finding the right one. Not a big deal, but annoying if one of you is trying to sleep, and the other is flashing lights on and off in an attempt to find the bathroom light. - There is a pillow menu in the room from which you can choose various types of pillows. A neat idea, and one that we took advantage of. After a night sleeping on my selected pillow, I decided that it didn't really work for me (but fun to try), only to realise that the maid had taken away my original pillow! I had to call housekeeping to have one of the original pillows delivered to the room. Not the end of the world, but I would have rather been sleeping than waiting up for a new pillow to be delivered to the room. - There are menus all over the room, listing things the hotel can provide: food, drinks, baths, pillows. However, the housekeeping/front desk numbers don't seem to appear on them or anywhere near the phone, so you will have to go thumbing through the hotel guide just to find the extension you are looking for. - The card key for our rooms did not work on a couple of occasions, so be sure to have a spare one on hand when you go out. - The 'do not disturb' sign was ignored on several occasions. I was awoken once, notwithstanding the do not disturb sign hanging on the door, while having a nap to have chocolates delivered to my room! Really, I could have waited. The next day, one of the maids proceeded to clean the bathroom while my husband was sleeping in the bed - he woke up rather surprised, to say the least! Conversely, we put out the sign to have the room made up for several hours in the morning, but when we came back to the hotel mid-afternoon, nobody had heeded it. - The bar in the lobby turns off the lights in the adjacent bathrooms during the afternoon. While I applaud their efforts at not wasting electricity, there does not seem to be any way to turn the light on if you need them! There are no motion detectors or switches that I could find at all, and I wound up actually cutting my hand on something while groping around in the dark. Very unpleasant. As the Skipper is situated next door to a hospital (and a medical centre with groovy architecture), the sound of ambulances can be heard constantly throughout the day and night. If you are not already a 'city sleeper', then a pair of earplugs would not go amiss. Of course, this is no fault of the hotel, but be forewarned. So, enough with the complaints. On the plus side, the location is great if you want to be near the waterfront. I went for a run next to the beach in the morning, and it was just beautiful. You can walk to the bars and restaurants of El Borne (if you are accustomed to walking - it might be a bit far otherwise). However, the Olympic tube stop is just a 5 minute walk away and will take you wherever you want to go without hassle. Watch out for pickpockets! As a side note, Villa Vinteca in the Borne is a fantastic wine shop with a huge selection for reasonable prices - you can go very inexpensive or break the bank, but they really know their stuff. There is a secluded little spot on the first floor of the hotel (2nd floor if you are coming from the US), around the corner to the right when exiting the lifts. It has lots of cozy chairs and a selection of reading magazines and books for browsing. A good place to chill for just a bit if you don't feel like sitting in your room or at the bar. If it's warm, head outside though! The staff that we dealt with were friendly and helpful. Clearly, none of the above are enough to rule out staying at the hotel completely. It is pretty swish, in a modern minimalist way. And I will caveat that all of the above bothered me more than my husband, so who knows, you may think it's perfect! No matter where you stay, Barcelona is an amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek and pleasant with some quirks”
Reviews.Author: Okemosian
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Skipper 8 nights for a combination conference/getaway. We found the staff quite accommodating and friendly and the hotel very pleasant. It does have a very minimalist decor but it grew on us. And the location is excellent. It's nice to be so close to the beach and some great beach-front restaurants, and to be fairly close to La Ramblas, etc. That said, we found a few things somewhat quirky, certainly the bathroom facilities. They don't supply kleenex (well, a teeny packet of tissues) or washcloths. They do offer combs and toothbrushes and other nice amenities. The shower was amusing - there is a 5-step instruction card to turning it on, which can be fun when you are seriously jetlagged. Likewise, the bathtub, outfitted with the same oh-so-sleek system, was a puzzle. We had to call down to the front desk to seek help with getting hot water. And in the end, it was not very hot - there is apparently some scald control built in, and I like my baths hot, but...And the shower leaked all over the floor each time, right into the toilet floor area. And the lighting, well, it makes you look positively cadaverous. The sink is trough-like and shallow, and the faucet controls reminded me of stick-shifts with no indicators. Much water was sprayed in all directions in trying to adjust them. It was all actually pretty humorous but I felt sorry for housekeeping, having to mop up so much water every day. So the bathroom was very sleek-looking but not the most functional/practical we've ever encountered. The bed was very comfortable. The noise level for us was pretty high as we were closest to the hospital nearby. Sirens at night, but we got used to it. Maid service was just fine. We and many of the attendees we were with had repeated trouble with their room key cards failing. We swapped ours out for new ones about 4 times. We ate only in the bar (not restaurant) area a couple times, and here's a tip - if you aren't interested in the five or so sandwiches etc. that they offer, just ask them to make up a plate of tapas. A much better deal, better food. For some very good and inxpensive sandwiches, soups, salads, just head to the beachfront - there's a very pleasant indoor/outdoor cafe/sandwich place nearish the casino (stay away from the casino, a rip-off) And there along the beachfront we also recommend Agua, a restaurant apparently quite popular with the locals. (Try the three-cheese risotto - to die for. ) The conference facilities were good and the free Internet on business pcs there was nice. Elevators were fast. Having been in Barcelona only once, I probably would try somewhere else on a 2nd trip, if only to see something new, not because our stay at the AB Skipper was negative. It was very nice, on the whole.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic weekend in a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: PJBManchester
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two night stay (26/27 Oct) at this fantastic hotel. We had been a little unsure about it's location but we shouldn't have worried, it suited us just fine. A short walk to the beach and a 15/20 minute walk takes you to the old town. The room was lovely and we really appreciated the fab toiletries, bath robes and slippers. We chose to eat out for lunch and dinner but can recommend the superb breakfast. The staff are more than happy to arrange eggs cooked to order or your choice of coffee, just ask. The reception staff, especially Claire, and the porters are also worth a mention. We will definitely return to this hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Looks fancier than it is”
Reviews.Author: London_Mo
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very modern looking. Location is a little weird, as you are out of the main action of Barcelona. There is a metro stop about 5 minutes away, and the beach is right there. Also if you are looking for cheesy touristy nightlife, the main spot for dancing and eating Pizza hut is right down the beach. There are two pools, we tried to go into one but it was too cold in September! I'm sure it's lovely in the summer though. We did go into the hot tub, although I hesitate to call it that, it was lukewarm at best. The room was nice and comfy, with a HUGE bed. Very modern looking, flat screen (with only 3 English speaking channels). The bathroom was a little too modern actually, it took me about a minute to find the toilet! The weirdest thing about the room was the windows, they were partially blocked out, so we couldn't really see out of them, even though the view was not much, just into the biotech centre across the way (people working in there would wave at us when we waved at them, so maybe that's why the widows are only partially glass, for privacy). Breakfast was nice, but not worth the 50 Euro. For that kind of money, I'd expect a feast for a king, but not so. I was upset, as a vegetarian to find ham in my eggs while I was eating them. Not a big deal, but there were only one kind of egg! For 50 Euro you'd think they'd have several dishes to choose from..... A decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay !”
Reviews.Author: Decky67
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days here in August. Our room was ultra modern with lcd tv, mini bar, balcony overlooking pool & sea, loewe bathroom products, rainforest shower, evening turndown. Breakfast well worth including in the price - offers both continental & various cooked options. Rooftop pool - fantastic ! Doesn't open till 10am which means German & English guests can't reserve beds at 5am then go back to bed !! Magic stay in a great city - would ONLY stay here when I return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bolli102
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel 5 star hotel - and it was.... Staff excellent helpful and friendly Rooms fitted out to a high spec, to include double ended baths and separate shower, large comfortable beds, mini bar, coffee n stuff, bathrobes and slippers. Beds turned down in the evening with a delicious chocolate and the wether forecast on a card. Menus - Food, pillows and even a bath menu! 2 pools one on the group floor and a roof top pool with bar and views over the harbour and the city.... chilled out music - bathrobes provided so very chilled out ideal for romantic weekends. - I could have stayed longer that 4 days but hubby would let me! Breakfast catered for all tastes - if your looking for a greasy fry up this is NOT the place to go... Close to the sea, bus tours five mins walk away as well as good local restaurant , drinks expensive in hotel but then you would expect that. We will be going back...

Reviews.Title: “A perfect birthday surprise”
Reviews.Author: TannerLondon
Reviews.Content: Returned yesterday from our stay at the AB Skipper and have to say that it more than met expectations. I booked a Delux room direct with the hotel as part of a surprise 40th birthday present for my girlfriend. I mentioned on the booking Comments that it was a birthday surprise and wanted a room on an upper floor with a sea view. Upon arrival the we were greeted by Olga at reception who spoke excellent English and was very friendly. She informed us that we had been upgraded to a superior room, located on the sixth floor with a sea view. Good start!. Room was the best I've ever stayed in: spacious, modern, great view of the beach and sea, huge king-sized bed, bathroom with jacuzzi, separate shower and seperate toilet, all the necessary toiletries you could wish for etc etc. We spent the first day on the roof terrace with pool, chilling out after an early morning flight. I won't go into detail but it was faultless. Early evening we received a complimentary bottle of Cava, which was a nice touch. On the day of my girlfreinds birthday we returned to our room about 6 to find Room Service had dressed the bed and jacuzzi with rose petals. I'm not one to normally write reviews, but this hotel made, what would have been a great stay anyway, a very special stay. They also booked some great restaurants for us. The Lomja De Tapas, in the Born district, great tapas and unpretentious. Birthday meal was at the Torre D'alta mar - sits at the top of Torre de San Sebastian which is a cable car tower and has 360 panaoramic views of Barcelona 75 metres up. Top class with top class prices, but a "special occassion" restaurant. Enough said. I will return next time I'm in Barcelona and needlesstosay recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: JB60TRAVELS
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 3 night stay at the AB Skipper. We had been in Barcelona before and wanted to stay at the beach this time. The previous time we stayed up closer to the 2 Gaudi buildings on P de Gracia.The location is not close to the tourist sites, but such sites are easily reached by public transit or a 6-7 euro cab ride. Our room was not ready when we arrived at the end of our cruise, but as the hotel was not full we were offered a free upgrade. The front desk staff all spoke English and were very helpful. Breakfast was included and the overall choices and quality were very high. The hotel was very clean and quiet. We had a king bed which was very comfortable.The TV in the room had several English language stations, including CNN.Our room was close to the street but we were not disturbed at all at night.The air conditioning worked very well, which is importanat in the Barcelona summer. The hotel has 2 nice size pools with an ample number of avaialble sun beds. There is an area with 4 computers with free internet access in the level below the main lobby. The only issue that we had was that the shower was slow to drain. We needed a taxi van to the airport so we spoke to the front desk clerk the night before our departure. He arranged for it and it was waiting for us the next morning at the time that was arranged. We considered the AB Skipper and the Hotel Arts for our stay. The AB Skipper was about half of the price of the Hotel Arts and we were very happy with the choice that we made.We would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ab Skipper is really good”
Reviews.Author: rajshah
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Ab Skipper( july30-aug 4th) and we really enjoyed our stay here.The rooms are comfortable and spacious . The bathrooms was also big with good supply of nice toiletiries . As the Hotel is very new , the bath towels are lovely and fluffy! The rooms are cleaned very well and do have free internet , however the wifi works in frequently but you can get a wired connection. For a city hotel , the 2 swimming pools are an added bliss. The Breakfast food quality is very good and the service is pleasant. The location is near the Port olympic area , which is a short (10 mins) walk to the city centre. The beach is only a 50m walk. Being vegetarians , we were surprised at the number of really good vegetarians restaurants. For pizza, La veronica is unbeatable and is located at 2-4 Rambla del Raval. Also La Bascula at 30 C. dels Flassaders is good for crepes, pastas,sandwiches ,fresh juices etc. Juicy Jones at 76 c.Hospital is good for freshly squeezed juices, lovely salads , sandwiches and is inexpensive., Amaltea at 164 Diptacio is another good veggie restaurant. So is Buenas Migas at 6 Placa Bonsucces.
